content.title: Hybrid Aortic Arch Repair
content.definition: Combined open surgical debranching of aortic arch vessels with endovascular stent-graft placement, allowing treatment of arch pathology while minimizing the morbidity of full open arch replacement.

primary: Aortic arch aneurysm in high-risk patients
Distal arch/proximal descending pathology requiring landing zone
Arch involvement in Type B dissection
patient_factors: High surgical risk for full open repair

zone_landing_requirements.zone_2: Left carotid coverage acceptable with revascularization

clinical_pearls: Zone 0 landing requires complete arch debranching
Stroke risk increases with more proximal zones
Retrograde Type A dissection is a feared complication
